question.text:
Consider the following statement w.r.t. transcription and select the right choice

(i) The promoter is said to be located towards the 5′-end of the coding strand.
(ii) The promoter is an RNA sequence that provides a binding site for RNA polymerase.
(iii) The terminator is located towards the 3′-end of the coding strand.
(iv) The strand that has polarity 3′→5′ acts as a template strand.

solution.text:
-Transcription is under the control of the enzyme RNA POLYMERASE (DNA dependent RNA polymerase)

-The promoter is the place which promotes transcription and promoter is situated upstreams of a structural gene at 5’

-Terminator is situated downstream of the structural gene at the 3’ end of the coding strand.

-One of the two strands of DNA takes part in transcription and which strand take part in transcription is known as master strand/antisense strand/non-coding strand/template strand/negative strand
